Review: On evaluating BGP routing stress attack

28 Aug 2015

This paper introduce a new attack inspired from synchronization and resonance in complex system. The attack is essentially exaust routerâ€™s storage processing power and storage capacity, and cause the routers to restart and reannounce its learned RIB table. By carefully select target routers to attack, the resonance effect could cause a globally flood of BGP announcements.

Evaluation by Simulation

Cascading Failure

If one AS fails, its neighbors need to withdraw all the routes learned from the failed AS. The ripple effects will cause a large amount of withdrawal and announcements.
